topic.title: Server issues
topic.shortdesc: Troubleshooting Couchbase Server is the basic action associated with critical and informational issues.

body.p: The following table outlines some specific areas to check when experiencing different problems:

row.entry: Couchbase Server does not start up.
Check that the service is running.
Check that the service is running.
Use the command-line interface to check connectivity.
Check the properties of the bucket to which you are attempting to connect.

body.p: The primary source for run-time logging information is Couchbase Server Web Console. Run-time logs are automatically set up and started during the installation process. However, Couchbase Server gives you access to lower-level logging details if needed for diagnostic and troubleshooting purposes.
Log files are stored in a binary format in the logs directory under the Couchbase installation directory. You must use browse_logs to extract the log contents from the binary format to a text file.
